messages.content: What does a self-diffusion coefficient describe?
A self-diffusion coefficient describes the rate at which a solute diffuses through a solvent when subjected to a concentration gradient.
How can it be computed from a simulation trajectory?
Self-diffusion coefficient can be computed from a simulation trajectory by calculating the mean square displacement of a solute particle over time.
Is there another way to compute it?

Another way to compute it is by using the Einstein relation between the mean square displacement and the diffusion coefficient, which relates the diffusion coefficient to the slope of the MSD plot at long times.
Can you give me a formula?
The Einstein relation is: MSD = 4Dt, where MSD is the mean square displacement and t is the time.
